singles.vanbancauhoi: A woman is talking about her family’s weekend. What does the family do most weekends?
A man is talking to a shop assistant. What does the man buy in the shop?
A man is talking on the phone. What did the man lose?
Jack is phoning his mom. What does Jack need to buy for his sister?
Anna is calling her friend. Where will they meet?
Lucy is calling her brother. What does the brother have to drink?
Listen to an auction man talking about a cabinet. Which part of the cabinet is original?
Listen to a voice message. How does Even feel?
Two friends are talking about their trip. What will the weather be like?
A man is talking about his holiday. How is he going to travel to the city?
Listen to a nutrition expert. What time is the best for children to eat fruit?
Greg is talking about a working day in his life. How does he go to work?
Listen to a tour guide. Where is the office located?

multiples.title: Đề 7 - Listening C14
multiples.des: Four people are talking about their journey to work. Complete the sentences below.

lstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich: "Mornings are actually my favorite time of day. I get to catch up with my friends, laugh about silly things, and just share a moment before the real day starts. We’re out there together, moving through the city like it’s our own little world. It’s funny how just talking and walking can make you forget about everything else. Sometimes, we even take a longer route just to keep the conversation going. By the time we get to work, I’m already in a good mood, ready for whatever comes my way."

"There’s something oddly comforting about my mornings. It’s like this in-between space where I’m not quite at home, not quite at work. I hop on the bus, find a seat if I’m lucky, and just watch the world go by. You see all kinds of faces, each with their own story, each heading somewhere. It’s not glamorous, but it’s my little escape—time to listen to my favorite songs or daydream out the window. By the time I step off, I’m ready to face whatever the day throws at me."

"Mornings are quiet, and that’s how I like it. It’s just me, the fresh air, and the city slowly waking up. I take my time, choosing the paths that are less crowded. I guess you could say it’s my way of getting ready for the day. There’s no rush, just the steady rhythm of my own footsteps. It’s my chance to breathe, to think, to just be by myself. By the time I reach work, I feel like I’ve had a small adventure all my own."

"Every morning, it’s just me, my car, and the open road. There’s a kind of freedom in it, you know? I get to decide my route, crank up my favorite tunes, and just go. Traffic can be a pain, sure, but it’s worth it for those moments when it’s just me and my thoughts. I like having that bit of control, especially before a busy day. Sometimes, I even take the scenic route, just to stretch out the time a bit. By the time I park, I’m in my zone, ready to take on whatever comes next."

multiples.title: Đề 7 - Listening C15
multiples.des: A man and a woman are talking about urban farming. Read the opinions below and decide whose opinion matches the statements, the man, the woman, or both the man and the woman. You can listen to the discussion twice.

lstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Living space is more important than farming space._
Farming space will benefit the urban economy._
Farming space is in need of more food._
lstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Woman starts

Woman: Hey Carlos, have you read the article about urban farming?

Man: Urban farming? What exactly is it?

Woman: Well, it’s about growing food in urban areas, like on rooftops or unused spaces, to help address food supply issues in cities.

Man: You mean farming in cities? How could that even work? Cities are already overcrowded. There isn’t enough space for housing, let alone farming. Urban farming will take up land that could be used for accommodation.

Woman: I think it makes sense. More people from rural areas are moving to cities, and food has become a critical issue. It’s vital that we adapt over time.

Man: That’s exactly my point. Where are all these people supposed to live?

Woman: You don’t have to take "urban farming" literally. It’s not about large-scale farming right away. Small changes are necessary. Over time, we need to find ways to balance ecological and economic needs.

Man: Sure, I support green initiatives, but they need to be practical. How can this approach actually work?

Woman: Unused spaces that are too small for housing can be converted into farming areas. If done right, this could be both beneficial and visually attractive, like turning them into green spaces or local parks.

Man: I still think this could have negative effects, especially on rural areas where traditional farmers might lose their jobs if urban farming takes over.

Woman: You should think of it as a supplement, not a replacement. For rural areas, producing vegetables closer to where they’re consumed can actually be beneficial. It saves on transportation costs and uses resources more efficiently.

Man: But this is mostly about food, right? I don’t think urban farming can solve the problem of scarcity.  Cities just can’t realistically support large-scale farming.Rural farming is still a more practical option.

Woman: That’s true, and I agree. But changes need to happen. Sooner or later, urban farming will become a key trend for the future.

multiples.title: Đề 7 - Listening C16
multiples.des: Listen to a critic talking about a newly broadcasted TV series.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: It didn’t receive enough investment at the early stage.
It caught the audience’s attention from the start.

lstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: According to the expert, what is the series’ potential?
lstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
A famous TV series called Mystery City was recently broadcasted, and it caught the audience’s attention from the start. The first episode was filled with suspense and surprising twists that left viewers eager for more. The engaging storyline and strong characters made it easy for people to connect with the show, which quickly became a topic of conversation. Social media buzzed with reactions and theories, making it a true phenomenon.

Beyond just entertaining, Mystery City has also helped its network reach new customers. The show attracted a diverse audience, including younger viewers who might not have watched traditional TV before. This is important for marketing because it shows how a single series can expand a network’s reach and boost subscriptions. With clever promotions and partnerships, the series brought in new fans who may now explore other shows on the platform.

Overall, Mystery City is not just a popular series; it’s a powerful tool for building a community around a brand. The combination of captivating storytelling and strategic marketing has made it a success that other networks will likely try to replicate. As the series continues, it will be interesting to see how it evolves and what new customers it brings in!

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: New seasons will be produced due to great demand.
It inspires young filmmakers to follow a new movie-making style.

multiples.title: Đề 7 - Listening C17
multiples.des: Listen to an advertising expert talking about the advertising industry.

lstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What does the expert say about advertising?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: It helps to reach new customers.
Advertisements might sometimes be repetitive which is annoying.
Advertising costs the same amount of money to produce a movie.

lstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: In what way can advertising affect sports?
lstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
The once-every-four-years Champion League is back this year, and it's creating a wave of excitement among sports fans. This year promises to be more thrilling than ever, especially with a rising star defeating one of the top three teams from last year to advance to the knockout stage. As interest grows among sports fans, advertising plays a crucial role in maintaining the game's popularity.

Innovative advertising strategies help brands expand their customer base to other countries, increasing their global reach. However, not all commercial advertising activities are beneficial for sports fans. While advertisements may boost the game's visibility and attract new audiences, they can sometimes detract from the viewing experience, with interruptions or overly commercialized content. It’s important to strike a balance between promoting the sport and maintaining its integrity for true fans.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: They help to attract more fans.
They can boost ticket sales and sales of sports related items.
They are not always good for sport fans

readings.title: Đề 7 - Reading p1
readings.des:
Choose one word from the list for each gap. The first one is done for you 
Hi James,

I (work/study/have) in an office in town.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: I start _ in the morning at 7:00 a.m
I have _ at a cafe near the office.
I _ the office at 5:00 p.m and go home
I drive home in my new _.
I go to sleep when I am _.

readings.title: Đề 7 - Reading p2
readings.des: The sentences below give information about Zinedine Zidane. Put the sentences in the right order. The first one is done for you.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: 0. Zinedine Zidane's journey began in Marseille, where he honed his skills.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: As a child, he played for several teams close to his home in Marseille.
He then left home to join Cannes Football Club in the south of France.
While he was in the club, he was seen as a talented player.
Later, he left France to advance his career in Italy and Spain, where he eventually stopped playing.
Since retiring, he has worked as a manager for a football club.

readings.title: Đề 7 -Reading p3
readings.des: The sentences below are part of a biography of  Milly Brook. Put the sentences in the right order. The first sentence is done for you.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: 0. From a young age, Milly Brook had a strong passion for sports.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: As a child, she spent countless hours practicing her favorite sport every day.
Because of this dedication and passion, she quickly improved her skills significantly.
The hard work and determination proved to be successful and rewarding.
They invited her to join their team, recognizing her exceptional talent and commitment.
A year later, after extensive training and dedication, she became a key player.

readings.title: Đề 7 - Reading p4
readings.des:
Four people were interviewed by the local sports center about doing exercise. Read the texts and complete the questions below.

Person A: 

As we get older, it’s easier to forget things. This is especially true when it comes to working out, particularly when it gets difficult. By this, I don’t mean preparing for things like long-distance events, but rather the routines and workouts we do regularly. To truly gain from these, they need to be done frequently, and ideally at the same time each day. In this way, it becomes an enjoyable and healthy routine.

Person B: 

Having someone by our side can help us when we just don’t feel motivated to exercise. Quite often in this situation, we don’t need expert assistance at the local gym. We just need a little extra encouragement from someone who knows us and understands how to motivate us. Afterwards, we can discuss our aching muscles, and it’s a great opportunity to enjoy a nutritious meal together. This also plays a role in restoring energy to our bodies.

Person C: 

 The whole motivation behind doing sport is the benefit for the body. Some people with unhealthy diets want to lose weight, so they constantly push themselves to the extreme. Perspectives on fitness, including frequency and intensity, have evolved. However, it’s better to pay attention to what your body is telling you and take a break if needed. If you’re uncertain, consult a trainer at the local fitness center.

Person D: 

The body and the relationship we have with it changes with time. When we’re older, it’s different from how it was in our younger years. However, this doesn’t mean that people should stop being active. Of course, the exercise needs to be gentler and less physically demanding than what we did in school. Older adults simply don’t need to compete or burn off the extra energy that young people often have.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Who thinks a routine can help us do more sport?_
Who thinks experiencing pain is not necessary?_
Who thinks competitions are not useful for everybody?_
Who thinks working out with a friend is a good idea?_
Who thinks exercise is for both the young and the elderly?_
Who thinks eating proper food is very important?_
Who thinks at times we should seek expert advice?_

readings.title: Đề 7 - Reading p5
readings.des:
Read the passage quickly. Choose a heading for each numbered paragraph (1-7) from the drop-down box. There is one more heading than you need. 

The Doggett’s Coat and Badge

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
1._
Thomas Doggett, an Irish actor and comedian who managed Drury Lane Theatre, created the race. He relied heavily on Thames watermen, who were vital for transportation at the time. With poor roads and crowded city streets, the Thames served as the primary highway. Doggett frequently commuted via the river between his London work locations and his home in Chelsea.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: Origins of what the winner receives
Not in it for the money
Why do people join Doggett’s Coat

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
2._
A popular story suggests that Doggett was saved by a waterman after falling into the Thames in 1715. To show his gratitude, he organized a race for six young watermen, offering a prize for the fastest rower on a 7.4-km course between two pubs named “The Swan” in London Bridge and Chelsea.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: Why do people join Doggett’s Coat
Origins of what the winner receives
Not in it for the money

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
3._
Unlike typical prizes, Doggett awarded a traditional red waterman’s coat with a silver badge inscribed with “Liberty.” This badge commemorated the coronation of George I of the House of Hanover on August 1, 1714. Doggett chose August 1 for the annual race to honor this event. The badge today still includes “Liberty” and an image of the Hanover horse. Doggett managed the race and financed it himself until his death in 1721.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: Why do people join Doggett’s Coat
Origins of what the winner receives
Not in it for the money

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
4._
After Doggett's death, the Fishmongers’ Company of London continued the race as specified in his will. However, the event now runs with the incoming tide, and competitors use racing boats instead of commercial vessels. In 1988, due to a decline in watermen, the Fishmongers’ Company allowed competitors three chances to win the race.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: Why do people join Doggett’s Coat
Origins of what the winner receives
Not in it for the money

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
5. _
The winner’s prize remains the traditional red waterman’s coat along with a silver badge featuring a horse and the word “Liberty.” Additionally, all competitors who finish the race receive a miniature version of Doggett’s badge for their collars at a ceremony held at Watermen’s Hall. The winner receives a silver badge, while other participants receive bronze ones. Historically, winning the Doggett’s Coat and Badge in the 18th and 19th centuries helped bring in more business for the successful waterman. Although this practical advantage is now somewhat outdated, achieving the Doggett’s Coat and Badge remains a highly respected honor.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: Why do people join Doggett’s Coat
Origins of what the winner receives
Not in it for the money

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
6._
In 2012, six rowers competed, and the race was won by 23-year-old waterman Merlin Dwan. Dwan comes from a family of watermen; his father won the Doggett’s Coat and Badge in 1977, and his uncle and two cousins have also won the race. However, the Dwan family doesn’t hold the record for the most wins—that title goes to the Phelps family, with ten victories.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: Why do people join Doggett’s Coat
Origins of what the winner receives
Not in it for the money

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
7._
The tradition of families winning the Doggett’s Coat and Badge highlights its enduring significance. Nowadays, being a waterman is likely viewed less as a career and more as a means of preserving a centuries-old family tradition. This heritage is upheld further by the exclusive group of watermen known as the Royal Watermen. Queen Elizabeth employs 24 watermen to accompany her on ceremonial occasions along the Thames. Each waterman earns a modest annual sum of £3.50 for this role, but the prestige of wearing the iconic red jacket and silver badge on important state occasions is invaluable.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: Why do people join Doggett’s Coat
Origins of what the winner receives
Not in it for the money

speakings.title: Đề 7 - Speaking part 1
speakings.des:
In this part, I am going to ask you three short questions about yourself and your interests. You will have 30 seconds to reply to each question.

Begin speaking when you hear this sound.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What activities do you usually do with your friends?
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Version 1: I’d like to share with you what I usually do with my friends, especially my best friend, who I’ve known for 5 years. We often hang out at a cafe shop and talk about everything that just pops out in our head, after that we drive around the city on her bike to admire the beauty of our city. That's all I want to share and thank you for listening. 


Version 2: When I’m with my friends, we usually play games together. Sometimes, we play football or basketball in the park. Other times, we stay indoors and play video games. We also like to talk and laugh a lot.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Tell me about your hobby.
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Version 1: Let me tell you about my hobby.Recently, I found out my new hobby is drawing. Drawing is fun, especially when I can share my artwork with my friends, who give me ideas to improve my drawing. That's all I want to share and thank you for listening. 

Version 2: My hobby is reading books. I enjoy reading because it helps me relax and learn new things. I like reading stories about adventure and animals. Sometimes, I read for an hour before bed. It’s my favorite way to spend free time.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Describe something you are planning to do in the future.
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Version 1: I’d like to share with you my future plans. In the next 2 years I want to learn a new language, which is Japanese. Also, I want to learn how to love myself more and have an active lifestyle. That's all I want to share and thank you for listening. 


Version 2: In the future, I plan to travel to another country. I want to visit Japan because it looks beautiful. I also want to learn more about Japanese culture and food. I hope I can go there with my family one day.

speakings.title: Đề 7 - Speaking part 2
speakings.des:
In this part, I'm going to ask you to describe a picture. Then I will ask you two questions about it. You will have 45 seconds for each response.

Begin speaking when you hear this sound.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Describe the picture
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
I can observe that this picture is a family car trip. 
In the front of the picture, the father, who is wearing a blue shirt, is driving and the mother is talking with her daughter, who is sitting behind them.
In the background, I cannot see anything because it is too blurry.
It is clear that they all are smiling and look very happy.
I guess they are on their vacation and on their way to their destination.
I really love this picture because I can feel the happiness and excitement from this family.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What was the last time you were in a car
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich: The last time I was in a car was last Sunday. I went to Cam Ranh to visit our relatives and my father drove me and my mother there. We spent two hours in the car and listening to music was the only way to help us feel less bored. However, I was admiring the views through the window, which is my favorite activity and we didn't talk much during the trip. The trip was normal to me and kind of boring, I must say.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: How can people pass time on a long travel?
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich: From my experience, we can listen to music to ease the boredom. The melody will make us feel awake and maybe light up our mood. Another activity is sleeping. Sleeping during the trip will help us feel less tired and it's an effective way to pass a long trip. However, we can choose to talk or make a conversation with someone to kill time. As for me, I would choose to admire the view while listening to my music. These are my suggestions about how to pass time on a long trip.

speakings.title: Đề 7 - Speaking part 3
speakings.des:
In this part, I'm going to ask you to compare two pictures, and I will then ask you two questions about them. You will have 45 seconds for each response.

Begin speaking when you hear this sound.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Describe the 2 pictures.
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
From both pictures, I can observe they are outdoor activities and quite adventurous.
The first picture shows me a lot of people riding on a small yellow boat, who I assume are a team. 
While the second one shows a man cycling on his bike.
In terms of the differences, I can see the first picture is a teamwork sport, and the second is an individual sport. 
As for me, I would choose the first picture because I like teamwork sports and spending time with my friends.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What are the difficulties of both sports?
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Well from my point of view, both sports are very difficult and I think here are some main ones.

First they are both adventurous sports so you need to be brave so play those sports. 

Second, they are not  for weak people, you may easily have a heart attack or blood pressure. Finally, it is financial. You will need a lot of money to buy necessary requirements and have to check your health regularly. 

For me, I would rather not play those sports because I don’t have the guts to play them.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Why some people prefer team sports than individual sports?
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
In my opinion, some people prefer team sports  because they like hanging out with friends. Thanks to team sports, they will strengthen their friendship and help them understand each other more. 

Another reason is because they want to experience and meet more people in the world. With this, a new friendship will be formed and will last long because of the same interest. 

As for me, I would prefer team sports too because they are fun when playing with my friends.

speakings.title: Đề 7 - Speaking part 4
speakings.des:
In this part, I'm going to show you a picture and ask you three questions. You will have one minute to think about your answers before you start speaking. You will have two minutes to answer all three questions.

Begin speaking when you hear this sound. Look at the photograph.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi:
Describe a time you were very busy 
How do you feel when you are busy?
If people work less, will their lives become better?
LstCauHoi.vanbangiaithich:
Now, I am going to answer the three questions that you gave me. 
Describe a time you were very busy 
How do you feel when you are busy?
If people work less, will their lives become better? 

Regarding the first question, let me tell you about a time I was busy and it was when I traveled to Danang City.
Da Nang is famous for its beaches, and for example one of them is My Khe, which is one of the most wonderful beaches in the world, so every year, there are many tourists going to the area to see the beauty of the beach. Therefore, going to this city was extremely expensive for me at that time.
So in Danang I did a number of things, first of all, I did some sightseeing in the mountains and I had a beautiful view of the city below.
During the trip, I was busy traveling to a lot of tourist destinations from early in the morning till late in the afternoon

Turning to the second question, I feel happy when I am busy because it makes me feel more active.
As for the final question, if people work less, their lives will become better. First, they can spend more time with their loved ones. Second, they can relax after a long day at work.

writings.title: Đề 7 - Writing part 1
writings.des:
You want to join a Food club. You have 5 messages from a member of the club. Write short answers (1–5 words) to each message. Recommended time: 3 minutes.

Example How are you? I'm fine, thanks.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: What is your favorite animal?
Where did you go last night?
What is your favorite time of year?
What is your job?
What is your favorite subject in high school?

writings.title: Đề 7 - Writing part 2
writings.des: You are a new member of the Food club. Fill in the form. Write in sentences. Use 20–30 words. Recommended time: 7 minutes.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: When and where do you usually eat meals?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: I usually eat meals at home with my family. I like to eat with my family because we can talk together, which helps us to relax and reduce stress after a long day of work.

writings.title: Đề 7 - Writing part 3
writings.des: You are communicating with other members of the club in the chat room. Reply to their questions. Write in sentences. Use 30–40 words per answer. Recommended time: 10 minutes.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: A: Tell me about a time you eat a nice meal?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: Let me tell you about a time when I had a nice meal, which was 3 days ago. I went out to eat with my friends in a big restaurant, where the food was delicious. I was most impressed with the perfectly cooked beef.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: B: Tell me about a place to eat local food (đồ ăn địa phương)? What food?

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi: A place to eat local food that I can recall (nhớ lại) is a restaurant selling Pho. I usually eat Pho here, which is my favorite food because it is cheap and convenient. I often eat Pho here on the weekends with my family members or my friends.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: C: People are likely to eat more and more fast food. It is unhealthy and they should eat less. What do you think? (mọi người thường ăn đồ ăn nhanh,. Nó thì ko tốt cho sức khoẻ và họ nên ăn ít hơn. Bạn nghĩ gì?)

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi:
People nowadays are likely to eat more fast food, such as fried chicken, pizza, or hamburger, which is definitely unhealthy. I believe that people shouldn’t eat too much fast food because this could affect their health badly. Moreover, fast food can sometimes be very expensive.
-> Sử dụng such as, for example, for instance để đưa ví dụ.
-> Sử dụng từ nối: First, Beside, In addition, Furthermore, Moreover, Plus….

writings.title: Đề 7 - Writing part 4
writings.des:
You are a member of the Computer Club. You received this email from the club’s manager.

Dear members,

We are planning a series of meetings on Wednesday, we need volunteers to have a short talk about food.  What will you talk about? Why do you think it is interesting?

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Write an email to your friend, who is also a member of this club. Tell your friend about your opinion and why. Write about 50 words

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi:
Hi, Lucy.
How are things? I hope that you are doing well.
Have you received the email from our club? The club is planning a series of meetings on Wednesday and we need volunteers to give short talks about food.
I am very surprised to hear this. I am interested in knowing more about street food among different cultures and believe that this could be an interesting topic that could last for a few sessions. However, I think we should have a meeting in order to discuss more about this.
What about you? What do you think? Do you have any suggestions?
Yours,
Leo.

LstCauHoi.vanbancauhoi: Write an email to the manager of the club. Tell the manager about your opinion and why. Write about 120-150 words.

lstdapan.vanbanphanhoi:
Dear Sir,
My name is Leo. I have been a member of this club for 5 months.
I’m writing this in response to your latest email.
According to the email, we are planning a series of meetings on Wednesday, and we need volunteers to have a short talk about food.
I was very surprised when I heard this. 
I would like to venture my ideas. My topic of interest is street food cultures around the world, where I’ll explore unique street foods of different places. I think this topic will be interesting for the audience because street food shows the culture of each place in a tasty and simple way. It also helps people enjoy the variety of (đa dạng) foods and see the creative ways local people make them around the world. However, I believe that we should discuss more about this. The club should organize a meeting, so members can share their thoughts on this as well as vote for their favorite ideas. By implementing these changes, we can ensure better attendance and engagement at the meeting, enhancing the overall experience for everyone involved (tóm tắt kết quả).
I hope that my suggestions are useful.
Best regards,
Leo
